qas.question: What was the name of the first central bank in France, that Napoleon established?
What was the name of the agreement that Napoleon arrived at with the Catholic Church?
What other document was presented along with the Concordat of 1801?
What did the Organic Articles regulate in France?
What is the name of the empire Napoleon dissolved that later led to unification in Germany?

context: Napoleon instituted lasting reforms, including higher education, a tax code, road and sewer systems, and established <a0_0>the Banque de France<a0_0/>, the first central bank in French history. He negotiated <a1_0>the Concordat of 1801<a1_0/> with the Catholic Church, which sought to reconcile the mostly Catholic population to his regime. It was presented alongside <a2_0>the Organic Articles<a2_0/>, which regulated <a3_0>public worship<a3_0/> in France. His dissolution of <a4_0>the Holy Roman Empire<a4_0/> paved the way to German Unification later in the 19th century. The sale of the Louisiana Territory to the United States doubled the size of the country and was a major event in American history.
